definition: to run away/to flee in disarray
to escape/to run away/to flee
to flee/to scuttle/to exile or banish/to amend or edit
to disperse and flee, leaving no trace

sentences.english: The enemy soldiers were fleeing in all directions, but few of them could escape.
sentences.chinese: 敌兵四处逃窜，但很少能逃出去。

sentences.english: The fugitive is believed to be headed for the Canadian border.
sentences.chinese: 据信，逃亡者正向加拿大边界方向逃窜。

sentences.english: Some unknown bugs have also been the arrival of I frighten of running around.
sentences.chinese: 一些不知名的小虫子也被我的到来吓的四处逃窜。

sentences.english: When rain suddenly came, the pedestrians ran helter-skelter.
sentences.chinese: 突然下雨，行人慌张逃窜。

sentences.english: The enemy ran away at our approach.
sentences.chinese: 敌人已在我军逼近时逃窜了。

sentences.english: The thief had jumped out of the window before the police broke in.
sentences.chinese: 警察还没来得及破门进入，小偷就已跳窗逃窜了。

sentences.english: The people took flight be fore the onrushing fire.
sentences.chinese: 大火卷来，人们纷纷逃窜。

sentences.english: Stolen jewels littered the floor when the robbers fled in a hurry.
sentences.chinese: 抢劫犯在慌乱逃窜时把抢来的珠宝遗撒一地。

sentences.english: They killed45 puppet troops and sent the rest fleeing panic-stricken.
sentences.chinese: 他们打死45名伪军，使其他的人都惊惶逃窜了。

sentences.english: The pubertal mice, however, failed to learn to avoid it even after several rounds.
sentences.chinese: 然而，发育期老鼠在几次逃窜之后却未能知道回避它。

sentences.english: Kony was later pushed even further west in the Central African Republic.
sentences.chinese: 科尼后来甚至向西逃窜至中非共和国。

sentences.english: With terror the knights and ladie flee.
sentences.chinese: 骑士们和妇人们惶恐逃窜。

sentences.english: The flash sent the foxes scampering away.
sentences.chinese: 闪光惊得狐狸四处逃窜。

sentences.english: The enemy soldiers fled and let the devil catch the hindmost.
sentences.chinese: 敌兵纷纷逃窜，听任后面的人遭殃。

sentences.english: They are the ones who are running. And we will catch them all and bring them to justice.
sentences.chinese: 逃窜的是他们，而我们将把他们一网打尽并绳之以法。

sentences.english: They are on the run and trying to block the exodus of civilians from the area.
sentences.chinese: 这些人正在逃窜，并且企图阻挡平民离开这一地区。

definition: to flee/to run away
to flee in disorder/to scurry off
to flee from sth/to run away/to escape
to escape/to flee/to run away
to escape/to disappear
in a panic/flurried
variant of 倉皇|仓皇[cang1 huang2]
to flee in disorder/defeated and in rout
to scatter in all directions
to escape/to flee/to run for one's life
to escape/to run away/to flee
to flee/to go into exile (from prison)
to escape without trace (idiom); to make one's getaway (from the scene of a crime)/to show a clean pair of heels
to pursue and attack
to escape/to run away/to abscond
to flee/flight (from danger)/fugitive
